name: Belltown Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Belltown last year for about 4 nights. Rooms are small but very clean. We had to open the windows at night to get some air but we were never hot (we're from new orleans, so 60 degree weather is wonderful) The staff at the front desk were super nice & very helpful w/any questions that we had. The roof top has a nice view of the city and the space needle. Belltown is also within walking distance to Pike Place Market and many restaurants. Felt safe walking around this area--day or night. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Cute, Clean, & Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Upsides: The Belltown Inn is 6 blocks from Seattle Center and 6 blocks from Pike's Place Market. The free downtown bus stops in front of the building. Wonderful restauants (like Shiro's) are just a short walk. There is a nice roof-top deck to enjoy with a glass of wine. There are lots of night spots in this neighborhood. The staff is friendly and accomodating and the price is terrific. You might be able to get a better deal if you call them directly: I did.
reviews.title: Good Value, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downsides: Belltown is a VERY noisy neighborhood. The hotel has no air conditioning but they give you a fan and there is also a very effective ceiling fan in the room. The noise makes it impossible to keep the window open.
reviews.title: Perfect In-town Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ask for a room facing the courtyard. Our room faced the west and you have a partial view of the water but the noise of the neighborhood revelers goes on all night. On the weekend the police apparently use the vacant lot to the west of the building as a staging area. There was a huge police RV with spotlights and 6 police cars parked there.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel could benefit from some black-out curtains over the blinds to help with the noise and the lights in the neighborhood. They keep the dryers at the front desk. Parking is available for an extra charge; the lot is down the block. The rooms are on the small side but very clean and everything is new.
reviews.title: Great Value, Terrific Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I chose the hotel using tripadvisor, and I am very happy about it: very good location (near city center, restaurants and nighlife), front desk very kind and helpful, room cleen and confortable, great service (free internet with 3/4 pc and free print, free bike).
reviews.title: Service, location and kindness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only defect is about location, very central end easy to arrive but not so beautiful as a place and frequentation (that part of 3rd ave).
reviews.title: Good little hotel, handy for everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I think also the price was quite good, especially during working days
reviews.title: contrast to Seattle Sprit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly desk staff, good-sized room with the bonus of a kitchenette (with popcorn and microwave supplied). Stayed in an inside room so cannot comment on any street noise, the hotel itself seemed very quiet. As others have commented the immediate area is not the best, however did not feel at risk wandering around in the evening (I'm used to London though, so if you come from a small town you will feel uneasy). Once you are a couple of blocks away you are in the middle of the restaurants/bars anyway. Great location, easy walk to the pike market and space needle, convenience store opposite with the essentials. Free internet at reception and bikes to borrow too!
reviews.title: Good hotel if you are there to party.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Aloof and cold staffs that is in contrast with nice weather in Seattle during May. One staff brough family member and boy friend to work, using guest computer room and not attendatitive to customers.
reviews.title: Stay Away: Transient Hotel in Meth Hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is central to downtown - just walk south on 2nd or 1st Ave, 3rd has very little to see/do (and is not recommended late at night), but there is a bus stop right there, and downtown buses are free. We had a courtyard room, so got a good night's sleep all three nights of our stay. The room was a normal size; the kitchenette was a great way to keep costs down on breakfast as well as to save treats and doggie bags (Seattle has some awesome restaurants, often with large portions). The staff was astonishingly helpful - even in deciphering the public transit system for us. The Inn also offers bikes/helmets/locks on loan (which we rode to Ballard and Fremont on nearby bike paths), and it has a "business center" complete with internet and printer. In short - the Belltown Inn had more amenities than my home, and at an unbeatable price. I would definitely return and recommend.
reviews.title: If it was in Europe, it would be 3+ stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Belltown Inn for 3 nights (June 28th-July1st, 2010). It is quite a nice little place to stay. Very clean and the staff were always eager to help with your inquiries. It is really close to anything you want to do downtown Seattle. Short walk to Pike's Market and Aquarium and also to the Needle and Downtown Shopping. Lots of nice restaurants close by as well as a convenience store just across the road. The kitchenette was great to have since we like a light breakfast with lots of fresh fruit which we picked up at the market our first day. It also allowed us to pack a lunch for our touring around and our flight home. If we ever get back to Seattle, we would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Deal!

reviews.text: Judy & Paul Davidson, Oshawa, Ontario
reviews.title: After Two Months here it has an been one of the best deals that I have come across in all of my years of travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Well this is the beginning of my third month staying at the Bell Town Inn,In Down Town Seattle,And They have gone out of there way to Help me with so many different things that I cannot begin to describe how important that is when a man comes all the way across the United States and Is away from his family and loved ones,And to have a staff that treats you with a sort of kindness ,that means so much,the hospitality is so sincere and accomidating, If you want a place that is safe and secure With the neighborhood being well policed,That I personally recommended this place to all of the people that are affiliated with the international bricklayers and allied craftsworkers union,As well as anybody that really wants to get an exceptional deal,You will not find a better Deal anywhere ,And the reason that I know that is, After all the research that I have done, To put Quite simply does not exist,I have a short walk to the Famous pike place market,And that is priceless all in it self with never having to get in to a cab or vehicle,If you want to be in the heart of the city ,And get the most bang for your Buck, And after two months I think that gives me a good idea as to what kind of place it is,And with that being said, That I highly Recommend That you Stay at the Bell Town Inn,In Downtown Seattle,sincerely Todd Naples''Michigan''
reviews.title: It was Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Great staff, lots of perks, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't overly familiar with the Seattle area before our trip and choose the Belltown Inn based on cost and TA reviews. The hotel was in a great location - walkable to the Space Needle and Pike's Place Market, as well as many great restaurants and bars. The hotel room itself was clean and comfortable. We'd stay here if in the area again and would recommend to others.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four days at the Belltown Inn while visiting family and touring around downtown Seattle. The Inn is very well-located being at one end of the "free ride" zone for public transport. If you are into walking, Pike Place Market is 15 minutes, the Space Needle only 10. The rooms are very clean, the reception friendly and helpful, and parking is across the street for $10 a day (24 hours) - a great deal for Seattle. The Inn has bikes (with helmets and locks) that may be borrowed and a deck on the roof. The only drawback was no internet in the rooms, although there is a business centre on the main floor offering computer access. The area around the hotel can be rather noisy in the evenings, but that also means that restaurants and bars are nearby. A great place to stay for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Inn includes nightly hotel guests as well as longer term residents. Rooms include small kitchen area (microwave, refrigerator and coffeepot). No utensils and dinnerware. This is great as there are many markets close by including Ralphs Market and Deli (4th Ave) where you can stock up on groceries. There is a small deli and cafe next door to the Inn as well as many restaurants in the vicinity. Staff are very helpful. Bike rentals (with helmets) are available at no charge along with free internet service in the business center. The Inn is within walking distance to all Seattle locations. Bus stop located outside front door. Light rail station to airport within a few walkable blocks. The Inn does not have fitness facilities but there is a 24 Hour Fitness located about 10 mins away. I stayed in a room facing the inner court. Nice and quiet. Clean and safe accomodations.
reviews.title: Great Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel to anyone seeking to stay in the Belltown area. The staff is very helpful, pleasant,and willing to hold your bags after checkout. While not particularly posh, the roof top patio affords a view of downtown, the waterfront, and a good part of the Space Needle. The Belltown Inn is within easy walking distance of the Pike Street Market, the Westlake LINK station and is within the "free" bus zone.
reviews.title: Great location - if a little noisy!

description: We offer beautiful guestrooms in a fantastic central location. We're located within easy walking distance of the historic Pike's Public Market, the Space Needle and Seattle Center grounds (including the Opera House, Key Arena, the EMP and Sci-Fi museum, Pacific Science Center and more), the Symphony Hall, the Convention Center, two major malls, the cruise ship terminals and central waterfront, and so much more. Our new and lovely guest rooms include spacious work desks and furnished kitchenettes.
